citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
**While inspecting the room used to prepare the pigs for surgical procedures, four expired heparin bottles ( 2 bottles lot
#wk607N 8/2018 and 2 bottles lot #105121 4/2023) and one expired atropine bottle (#210741 3/2023) were found in the
drug cabinet. There were 14 pigs used for a protocol in July of 2023 that received atropine as part of their anesthesia. An
IACUC semiannual facility inspection was conducted in July of 2023 prior to the surgical lab that was conducted in July.
The IACUC facility inspection states that “MITI program for drug storage and control is in place” is acceptable.
**Using expired medication can cause animals to have adverse animal welfare effects. All drugs that are used on animals
must be used within the dates listed by the manufacturer.
Correction Date: October 1, 2023

**During a review of the IACUC records, no copy of the contingency plan was noted. The following was noted in the
IACUC Policies and Responsibilities, Section 5: MITI Disaster Plan states “NEEDS REWRITTEN FOR CHICAGO”. There
is further discussion of a disaster plan but all of the contacts and information were for the Nevada location. The Animal
Welfare Act requires all registrants to have a contingency plan in place by July 5, 2022.
A contingency plan and annual review documentation specific to site 002 should be in place and available to APHIS upon
request. It is the responsibility of the registrant to develop and follow an appropriate contingency plan that provides for the
humane handling of the animals in the event of an emergency or disaster in order to prevent adverse impacts to the
animals.
.
Correction Date: October 1, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Kristin Ray, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
